advice: Prioritize quality sleep of 7-9 hours nightly. Sleep is when your body repairs and regenerates.
Practice intermittent fasting. Time-restricted eating activates cellular repair processes.
Move your body daily. Even a 30-minute walk significantly reduces mortality risk.
Cultivate deep social connections. Strong relationships are one of the strongest predictors of longevity.
Eat more plants. A diet rich in vegetables, fruits, and whole grains reduces chronic disease risk.
Practice stress management through meditation or breathwork. Chronic stress accelerates aging.
Stay mentally active. Continuous learning and mental challenges build cognitive reserve.
Limit alcohol consumption. Even moderate drinking has been linked to health risks.
Get regular sun exposure for vitamin D, but protect your skin from excessive UV damage.
Find purpose in life. Having meaning and goals is associated with longer lifespan.
Practice gratitude daily. Positive emotions contribute to better cardiovascular health.
Stay hydrated. Proper hydration supports every cellular function in your body.
